intro: Podocarpus formosensis, commonly known as the Taiwan podocarp, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Podocarpaceae family and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The plant exhibits a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 20 meters in its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various wildlife species and contributing to forest biodiversity.
